title: Wall St opens lower as U.S.-China trade tensions weigh - Nasdaq.com
text: Sept 3 (Reuters) - U.S. stocks fell broadly at the open on Tuesday, as Washington's new round of tariffs on some Chinese goods kicked in and after a report that officials from both sides were struggling to decide on the schedule for a meeting this month.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average  fell 205.02 points, or 0.78%, at the open to 26,198.26.
The S&P 500  opened lower by 17.45 points, or 0.60%, at 2,909.01. The Nasdaq Composite  dropped 56.44 points, or 0.71%, to 7,906.44 at the opening bell.
